Articles.Content: I have recently re-installed KSP on steam and when I press play steam does its normal route of launching a game but then a white screen opens for a few seconds and a crash window opens up.I used to be able to run KSP fine but now it wont work.Help please

Hi Bemosco, the game will make an output_log.txt file in the KSP_Data folder, right click KSP in Steam and browse the local files to find it.

It should help us determine what's going on.

Also, please see this thread.

38 minutes ago, sal_vager said:

Hi Bemosco, the game will make an output_log.txt file in the KSP_Data folder, right click KSP in Steam and browse the local files to find it.

It should help us determine what's going on.

Also, please see this thread.

Sorry for any miscommunication, I am new to the forums.

 

Edited July 16, 2016 by Red Iron Crown
Spoilered long log.

Not a worry, but the log is important as this has only been reported a handful of times, the exact cause is not known, one player reinstalled Windows to resolve it.

The white screen suggests that the Unity engine isn't able to start properly, at a guess I'd say it's graphics but that's just a guess without logs.
I have been getting that since 1.0.5, tabbing onto another window for a few minutes stops the issue.

4 hours ago, sal_vager said:

On 18/07/2016 at 7:29 AM, bemosco said:

Ram is 2048Mb, i know its not the minimal amount but i was able to run KSP before just fine with it, Windows 7 Home Premium 32-bit(6.1,build 7601)

While your current specs may have worked okay for very early versions of the game, the extra content present in the latest version means that your system no longer meets the requirements. Bear in mind that your OS also needs to use RAM to run background processes, so as it stands there's practically no RAM left to run KSP.

To play the latest versions of KSP comfortably (with or without mods), I personally run 16GB of RAM and Windows 10 Pro 64-bit - this last bit is important, otherwise your OS and game won't be able to utilize the extra RAM.

In short, I'm afraid it's time you invest in a new computer with better hardware specs.
